result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ramon L Thornton

records.addlTxt: Court is down on 12-15-2022.  Court rescheduled plea/sentencing hearing.  This hearing will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Ramon L Thornton in court.  Attorney Christopher J. Cherella in court for Ramon L Thornton.  Attorney Dax Odom in court on behalf of Brittany Skye Kachingwe for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a Plea/sentencing. Parties requested an adjournment, granted by the court. Case remains calendared in Branch 40.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Jury Instructions, received and filed.
Court scheduled a plea/sentencing date upon request from the parties.  Scheduling conference set for 8-31-2022 is cancelled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 9:00 am.

Defendant Ramon L Thornton in court with Attorney Christopher J. Cherella; both appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Christopher J. Cherella in court appear by video.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant having failed to appear/comply with the conditions of his release, the court ordered a stayed Bench Warrant.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 04/29/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Ramon L Thornton in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 039756,
Payable Number: 1001939,
Receipt Number: 22RP016685,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/27/2022@01:00PM
